com.datecs.pinpad

Class Pinpad

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.datecs.pinpad.Pinpad

  • public class Pinpad
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a Pinpad functionality.

    The table below describes the methods names mapping between original Necomplus EMV kernel library and the the interface of that this class provides to be used by a higher level application.

    Necomplus names Java names
    shEMVInit emvInit()
    shEMVDeinitialise emvDeinitialise()
    shEMVGetVersion emvGetVersion()
    shEMVATRValidation emvATRValidation(boolean, byte[])
    shEMVLoadTermAppList emvLoadAppList(int, boolean, EMVApplication[])
    shEMVGetCommonAppList emvGetCommonAppList()
    shEMVInitialAplProcessing emvInitialAppProcessing(byte[])
    shEMVReadApplData emvReadAppData(int[])
    shEMVAuthentication emvAuthentication(boolean)
    shEMVProcessRestrictions emvProcessRestrictions()
    shEMVTerminalRisk emvTerminalRisk(boolean)
    shEMVGetAuthMethod emvGetAuthenticationMethod()
    shEMVSetAuthResult emvSetAuthenticationResult(int)
    shEMVVerifyPinOFF emvVerifyPinOffline()
    shEMVGenerateCertificate emvGenerateCertificate(int, int)
    shEMVMakeTransDecision emvMakeTransactionDecision()
    shEMVMakeDefaultDecision emvMakeDefaultDecision()
    shEMVAuthenticateIssuer emvAuthenticateIssuer()
    shEMVScriptProcessing emvScriptProcessing(int)
    shEMVUpdateTVR emvUpdateTVR(int, int, boolean)
    shEMVUpdateTSI emvUpdateTSI(int, int, boolean)
    shEMVCheckTVR emvCheckTVR(int, int)
    shEMVCheckTSI emvCheckTSI(int, int)
    shEMVLoadClearPublicKey emvLoadPublicKey(int, int, int, int, byte[], byte[])
    shEMVRemovePublicKey emvRemovePublicKey(int, int)
    shEMVSetDataAsBinary emvSetDataAsBinary(int, byte[])
    shEMVSetDataAsString emvSetDataAsString(int, String)
    shEMVGetDataAsBinary emvGetDataAsBinary(int)
    shEMVGetDataAsString emvGetDataAsString(int)
    shEMVGetDataDetails emvGetDataDetails(int)
    shEMVGetDataDetails emvGetDataDetails(int)

      void emvATRValidation(boolean warmReset, byte[] atr)
      The command is in charge of validating the ATR sequence got from the card to ensure that is fully EMV complaint and that obeys the rules stated in the specification.
      void emvAuthenticateIssuer()
      The command is used to validate the cryptogram got from the issuer.
      void emvAuthentication(boolean checkAmount)
      Through this command the card data is authenticated depending on the capabilities of the card and the kernel.
      void emvCheckTSI(int byteIndex, int bitIndex)
      The command is intended to verify an individual bit within the TSI.
      void emvCheckTVR(int byteIndex, int bitIndex)
      The command is intended to verify an individual bit within the TVR.
      void emvDeinitialise()
      The command allows the application to release all the resources assigned in the initialization process.
      void emvGenerateCertificate(int type, int risk)
      Using this command the application will be able to generate an application cryptogram, the first or the second one, as required by the transaction.
      void emvGetAuthenticationMethod()
      The command starts or resumes the card holder authentication procedure, the current verification method is communicated to the application.
      EMVCommonApplications emvGetCommonAppList()
      The command gets back the list of common applications supported by the terminal and the card, actually this commands will end or resume the selection procedure.

      The command gets a data item in binary format (raw data).

      The command allows the application to gather details about the EMV kernel software version and release date.
      void emvInit()
      Through this command the kernel initializes itself and checks that everything is ready to work properly.
      void emvInitialAppProcessing(byte[] aid)
      Once an application has been selected, the next phase is to start the transaction with it by issuing the GET PROCESSING command and analyzing the information got.
      void emvLoadAppList(int method, boolean includeBlocked, EMVApplication[] applications)
      The command initiates the application selection process, loading the application list supported by the terminal.
      void emvLoadPublicKey(int rid, int index, int method, int algorithm, byte[] module, byte[] exponent)
      The command load public key.
      void emvMakeDefaultDecision()
      The command checks the default action code (provided by the application and read from the card), the TVR and will determine how the transaction is resolved by default.
      void emvMakeTransactionDecision()
      The command checks the action codes (provided by the application and read from the card), the TVR and will determine how the transaction is resolved.
      void emvProcessRestrictions()
      The command performs the restrictions processing related to application version, application usage control and effective and expire dates.
      void emvReadAppData(int[] tags)
      The command reads and validates the data informed in the AFL and that will be used along the transaction.
      void emvRemovePublicKey(int rid, int caIndex)
      The command is intended to delete a given CA public key.
      void emvScriptProcessing(int script)
      The script processing retrieved in the online authorization is handled by this command.
      void emvSetAuthenticationResult(int authResult)
      Using this command the kernel gets the result of the previously informed verification method.
      void emvSetBypassMode(int mode)
      With this command is possible to setup the behavior of the KERNEL regarding the PIN based method bypass, so that only the current method will be bypassed or any other found later in the CVM list will be considered so as well.
      void emvSetDataAsBinary(int tag, byte[] data)
      The command sets a data item with data in binary format (raw data).
      void emvSetDataAsString(int tag, byte[] data)
      The command sets a data item with data in string format.

      The command sets a data item with data in string format.
      void emvSetTags(byte[] TLVList)
      Set multiple of tags.
      void emvTerminalRisk(boolean forceProcessing)
      The application risk control is done by this command, including floor limit checking, random selection (only if offline is enabled) and velocity checking.
      void emvUpdateTSI(int byteIndex, int bitIndex, boolean set)
      The command allows modifying the TSI directly, setting or clear the desired bits.
      void emvUpdateTVR(int byteIndex, int bitIndex, boolean set)
      The command allows modifying the TVR directly, setting or clear the desired bits.

      • TAGS_FORMAT_DATECS

        public static final int TAGS_FORMAT_DATECS
        Encrypted tags format Datecs. The packet contains:
        • Format ID [4 bytes, big endian]
        • Encrypted data [variable length]
        After decrypting the data, it contains:
        • Format ID [4 bytes, big endian]
        • Data length [2 bytes, big endian] - the length includes the Packet ID, Random data, Tags and Serial number
        • Packet ID [4 bytes, big endian] - same number that was passed by the function to get the tags
        • Random data [4 bytes]
        • Device unique serial number [16 bytes] - this is the CPU serial number, that is guaranteed to be unique
        • Tags [variable length] - plain TLV structure with the requested tags and data
        • SHA256 [32 bytes] - hash of the Packet ID, Random data, Serial number and tag data
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final int EMV2_ALG_EH_ECC
        Encrypted Head ECC encryption algorithm
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EMV2_ALG_EH_AES256

        public static final int EMV2_ALG_EH_AES256
        Encrypted Head AES256 encryption algorithm. Encryption type is CBC. After decryption, the result data will be as follows: - Random data (4 bytes) - Device identification text (16 ASCII characters, unused bytes are 0) - Processed track data in the format: 0xF1 (track1 data), 0xF2 (track2 data) 0xF3 (track3 data). It is possible some of the tracks will be empty, then the identifier will not be present too, for example 0xF1 (track1 data) 0xF3 (track3 data) - End of track data (byte 0x00) - CRC16CCIT (2 bytes) - the CRC is performed from the start of the encrypted block (the Random Data block) to the end of the track data (including the 0x00 byte). The data block is rounded to 16 bytes
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EMV2_ALG_EH_IDTECH

        public static final int EMV2_ALG_EH_IDTECH
        Encrypted Head IDTECH encryption algorithm, please refer to IDTECH documentation for detailed format and examples. Data, that is received via magneticCardEncryptedData has the following format: - (1 byte) card encoding type, can ignore - (1 byte) bits marking which track is present - (1 byte) track 1 UNENCRYPTED length - (1 byte) track 2 UNENCRYPTED length - (1 byte) track 3 UNENCRYPTED length - (track 1 UNENCRYPTED length bytes) track 1 masked data - (track 2 UNENCRYPTED length bytes) track 2 masked data - (track 3 UNENCRYPTED length bytes) track 3 masked data - (variable bytes) Track 1 + Track 2 encrypted data, the length of this block is calculated by subtracting from the end - (20 bytes) track 1 sha1 - (20 bytes) track 2 sha1 - (10 bytes) KSN Encrypted block contents after decryption (3DES): - (track 1 UNENCRYPTED length bytes) track 1 data - (track 2 UNENCRYPTED length bytes) track 2 data
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • cryptoSaveKeysToFlash

        public void cryptoSaveKeysToFlash()
                           throws PinpadException,
                                  java.io.IOException
        Save all changes on keys to flash.

        If this command must be executed after changes are made. The changes are temporary stored in internal RAM but after restarting is read from flash. If no this command is executed the old values will be active after restarting.

        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

                           java.io.IOException

      • cryptoExchangeECBKey

        public byte[] cryptoExchangeECBKey(int kek,
                          int key,
                          int usage,
                          int version,
                          byte[] data)
                            throws PinpadException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        Loads new 3DES ECB key.
        Parameters:
        kek - the index of key, used to decrypt the encrypted key data when loading. The value can be between 0 and 49, where on index 0 resides the HMK key.
        key - the index where key shall be saved. For DUKPT keys this value can be between 0 and 1. For other keys the value can be between 1 and 49.
        usage - the key usage (type of key) attributes. See the KEY_* constant field values.
        version - the key version. Not used if key usage is KEY_TR31 or KEY_DUKPT.
        data - the 16 or 26 byte of input data to be processed. The first 16 bytes must contains encrypted key and next 10 bytes (if presents) are key serial number.If key usage is KEY_TR31 then TR31 block should be provided.
        Returns:
        the check value.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • scInit

        public void scInit(int slot,
          int voltage,
          int protocol)
            throws PinpadException,
                   java.io.IOException
        Initializes SmartCard module.

        Call this function before any other SmartCard related one. Without initialization, no SmartCard events will be fired.

        Parameters:
        slot - the slot you want to operate with, one of:
        SC_SLOT_MAINmain SmartCard slot
        SC_SLOT_SAMSAM module slot
        voltage - the smart card operating voltage, one of:
        SC_VOLTAGE_33V
        SC_VOLTAGE_55V
        protocol - the communication protocol, one of:
        SC_PROTOCOL_T0default, you probably need this one
        SC_PROTOCOL_T1T1
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • msGetCardData3DESCBC

        public byte[] msGetCardData3DESCBC(int keyId,
                          int sessionId)
                            throws PinpadException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        Read card data encrypted with 3DES CBC.
        Parameters:
        keyId - the key index. If the index is 0xFF then the last generated DUKPT key is used.
        sessionId - the session identifier. The same number exists into encrypted block.
        Returns:
        the card data. The data contains 1 byte tracks mask and the rest is encrypted card track data.
        The encrypted data contains:
        Field Size Description
        random 4 bytes The random generated number.
        session 4 bytes The session id number.
        length 2 bytes (MSB first) The data length.
        data (length) bytes The card tracks data. Every track, if exists have a prefix to it - 0xF1 for first, 0xF2 for second and 0xF3 for third.
        checksum 2 bytes(MSB first) The crccitt16 over random, length and data fields.
        padding 0~7 bytes The zero bytes padding
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • msGetCardData3DESCBC

        public byte[] msGetCardData3DESCBC(int mask,
                          int keyId,
                          int sessionId)
                            throws PinpadException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        Read card data encrypted with 3DES CBC.
        Parameters:
        mask - the mask format:
        b0 b1 b2 b3 b4 b5 b6 b7 Description
        1 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 Every track, if exists have a prefix to it - 0xF1 for first, 0xF2 for second and 0xF3 for third.
        0 1 0 0 0 0 0 0 Reserved.
        0 0 1 0 0 0 0 0 Read JIS card.
        0 0 0 1 0 0 0 0 Reserved.
        0 0 0 0 1 0 0 0 Reserved.
        0 0 0 0 0 1 0 0 Read track 3.
        0 0 0 0 0 0 1 0 Read track 2.
        0 0 0 0 0 0 0 1 Read track 1.
        keyId - the key index. If the index is 0xFF then the last generated DUKPT key is used.
        sessionId - the session identifier. The same number exists into encrypted block.
        Returns:
        the card data. The data contains 1 byte tracks mask and the rest is encrypted card track data.
        The encrypted data contains:
        Field Size Description
        random 4 bytes The random generated number.
        session 4 bytes The session id number.
        length 2 bytes (MSB first) The data length.
        data (length) bytes The card tracks data. Every track, if exists have a prefix to it - 0xF1 for first, 0xF2 for second and 0xF3 for third.
        checksum 2 bytes(MSB first) The crccitt16 over random, length and data fields.
        padding 0~7 bytes The zero bytes padding
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • msGetCardData3DESCBC

        public byte[] msGetCardData3DESCBC(boolean smart,
                          int keyId)
                            throws PinpadException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        Read card data encrypted with 3DES CBC.
        Parameters:
        smart - emulate track2 from smart card.
        keyId - the key index. If the index is 0xFF then the last generated DUKPT key is used.
        Returns:
        the encrypted track 2 data.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

        public byte[] msGetMaskedCardData(int unmaskedDigitsAtStart,
                         int unmaskedDigitsAtEnd,
                         int unmaskedDigitsAfter)
                           throws PinpadException,
                                  java.io.IOException

        unmaskedDigitsAtEnd - the number of digits to show in clear text at the end of the PAN, range from 0, to 4.
        unmaskedDigitsAfter - the the number of digits to show in clear text after the PAN, range from 0, to 7.
        Returns:
        masked card data.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • uiDrawString

        public void uiDrawString(byte[] text)
                  throws PinpadException,
                         java.io.IOException
        Display some text, starting at current cursor position in current window.

        The text can contain control symbols that alter cursor position, colors or whole window.
        If the cursor is moved forward from last (bottom right) display position, the cursor is moved at first (top left) position.
        If the cursor is moved backward from first (top left) display position the cursor is moved at last (bottom right) position.
        Note on special behavior - when you fill the current line and the next symbol is , then blank line will be left, because the cursor position is already on the next line and executing produces it. An example:
        Line1Line2 in normal situations will produce:
        Line1
        Line2
        But if the current text window ends exactly after Line1, then the result will be:
        Line1

        Line2

        If an illegal character code is send in MODE2 the command will not display the character and no error code will be returned.

        Parameters:
        text - the text string to write. Special codes that can be used are:
        0x01clears text window, moves the cursor to the top-left position
        0x02 X Ymoves cursor to position X,Y (X and Y must be send like X+0x80 and Y+0x80)
        0x03moves cursor one position left
        0x04moves cursor one position right
        0x06clears current line from the cursor to the end
        0x08backspace
        0x0Anewline (moves cursor at the beginning of the next line)
        0x0Bturns on character inversion
        0x0Cturns of character inversion
        0x0Dmoves cursor at the end of the current line
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • uiDrawString

        public void uiDrawString(java.lang.String text)
                  throws PinpadException,
                         java.io.IOException
        Display some text, starting at current cursor position in current window.
        Parameters:
        text - the text string to write.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        uiDrawString(byte[])

      • uiReadKey

        public int uiReadKey()
              throws PinpadException,
                     java.io.IOException
        Reads key from the pinpad. Key codes are:
        0x01/0x03 Numeric key have been pressed, but no numeric mode is enabled
        '0'-'9' Number keys 0-9, available only in numeric mode
        'A' Accept button have been pressed
        'C' Cancel button have been pressed
        'a','b','c' Functional buttons 1-3
        Returns:
        the key value.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • uiEnableNumericMode

        public void uiEnableNumericMode(int x,
                       int y,
                       int language,
                       byte[] text)
                         throws PinpadException,
                                java.io.IOException
        Enables numeric mode for the keyboard, allowing to read numbers.

        In this mode an application is allowed to read numeric keys, but the control over the display is very restricted. The screen is cleared, then the message is written starting from the top-left. Functions like uiDrawString(byte[]) can no longer print symbols in this mode, but you can display numbers or special symbols like '*'

        This function disable the status line, if present (MPED-400)

        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate to set the cursor.
        y - the y coordinate to set the cursor.
        language - - language code:
        LANG_ENGLISH English
        LANG_BULGARIAN Bulgarian
        LANG_ESPANIOL Spanish
        LANG_RUSSIAN Russian
        LANG_ROMANIAN Romanian
        LANG_FRENCH French
        LANG_FINISH Finish
        LANG_SWEDISH Swedish
        text - the text to display. The message is not a free text, it can have numbers and symbols in (0x20~0x40), but not characters. For security reasons the text in can be composed only from a predefined set of words. Special codes inside it control the behavior:
        0x1B n Inserts predefined text with index 'n'
        0x0A Go to next display line

        Predefined set of words, listed for English:
        0x01 AMOUNT
        0x02 NEW
        0x03 TOTAL
        0x04 REPEAT
        0x05 ENTER
        0x06 ADD
        0x07 INPUT
        0x08 CALL YOUR BANK
        0x09 BALANCE
        0x0A TIP
        0x0B RECEIPT
        0x0C SERVICE
        0x0D DONATION
        0x0E WAITER
        0x0F OPERATOR
        0x10 NUMBER
        0x11 TABLE
        0x12 REFERENCE
        0x13 INVOICE
        0x14 INCIDENCE
        0x15 PAN
        0x16 CARD
        0x17 DATE
        0x18 EXPIRY
        0x19 START
        0x1A END
        0x1B MMYY
        0x1C CVV/CVC
        0x1D SPLIT BY
        0x1E PARTIES
        0x1F TO PAY
        0x20 CASHBACK
        0x21 DUE
        0x22 MAXIMUM
        0x23 MINIMUM
        0x24 MULTIPLES OF
        0x25 FORMAT
        0x26 ID
        0x27 NUMERO
        0x28 BILL
        0x29 CASH
        0x2A CHEQUE
        0x2B VOUCHER
        0x2C PAYMENT
        0x2D REFUND
        0x2E PASSWORD
        0x2F CARD NUMBER
        0x30 EXPIRY DATE
        0x31 AND
        0x32 LENGTH
        0x33 ERROR
        0x34 ERRONEOUS
        0x35 TO
        0x36 AGAIN
        0x37 NO
        0x38 VALID
        0x39 INEXISTANT
        0x3A EXISTANT
        0x3B SELECT
        0x3C LANGUAGE
        0x3D YOUR
        0x3E OF
        0x3F FROM
        0x40 CODE
        0x41 AUTHORIZATION
        0x42 TICKET
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

        charsY - the height of the window in characters. If you pass 0, the charsY will be automatically calculated
        font - - font size, one of:
        FONT_6X86x8 font
        FONT_8X168x16 font
        FONT_4X63x6 font
        codepage - - code page used for the text, one of:
        CP_LATIN1West European

        CP_CYRILLICCyrillic

        public void uiEnterPin(int x,
              int y,
              int timeout,
              char echo,
              byte[] message)
                throws PinpadException,
                       java.io.IOException
        Enter PIN.

        timeout - the timeout in seconds waiting for the user to enter the pin (10~180).

      • uiEnterPinAsync

        public void uiEnterPinAsync(int x,
                   int y,
                   int timeout,
                   char echo,
                   byte[] message,
                   Pinpad.PINEntryCompleteListener l)
                     throws PinpadException,
                            java.io.IOException
        Initiates asynchronous PIN entry procedure. The PIN is stored encrypted and protected inside the pinpad. This function is not blocking, it passes the answer via listener. The PIN entry process can be stopped with method uiEnterPINCancel(). Then the callback shall be fired with error code ERROR_CANCEL}.
        Parameters:
        x - the X coordinate in characters from the left end of the defined window where the PIN entry prompt will be drawn.
        y - the Y coordinate in characters from the top of the defined window where the PIN entry prompt will be drawn.
        timeout - the timeout in seconds waiting for the user to enter the pin (10~180).
        echo - the symbol used to mark the pin digits, allowed are '*', '+' or '-';
        message - the text to be displayed to the user. You can use to move the cursor to the next line.
        l - The callback that will run when pin entry complete.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • uiVerifyPINOnline

        public byte[] uiVerifyPINOnline(int mode,
                       int format,
                       byte[] variant,
                       int key,
                       byte[] pan)
                         throws PinpadException,
                                java.io.IOException
        Online PIN verification.
        Parameters:
        mode - the mode. The value must be one of:
        0x02 - DUKPT
        0x03 - MKSK
        0x04 - FIXED
        format - the PIN block format. The value must be one of:
        0x04 - ISO0
        0x05 - ISO1
        0x0D - ISO3
        variant - the 16 bytes XORed with key before encrypting or encrypted session key when MKSK is specified.
        key - the key id. The value for DUKPT is 0 or 1.
        pan - the PAN number in ASCII. If PAN in null then it is obtain from the Pinpad. This parameter is ignored if format is ISO1.
        Returns:
        the encrypted PIN.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • uiStartAnimation

        public void uiStartAnimation(int x,
                    int y,
                    int animation,
                    boolean repeated)
                      throws PinpadException,
                             java.io.IOException
        Draws predefined animation on the screen.

        You can have multiple animations active. Not all animations are present in every Pinpad.

        Parameters:
        x - the top left X coordinate of the animation in pixels.
        y - the top left Y coordinate of the animation in pixels.
        animation - the predefined animation:
        ANIM_INSERT_CARDInsert card animation (MPED400)
        ANIM_REMOVE_CARDRemove card animation (MPED400)
        ANIM_BUSYBusy animation (MPED400,PPAD1)
        ANIM_DROPWater drop animation (MPED400,PPAD1)
        ANIM_INSERT_SMARTCARDInsert smart card animation (PPAD1)
        ANIM_INSERT_MAGNETIC_CARDInsert magnetic card animation (PPAD1)
        repeated - if true, the animation will play continuous until stopped.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • uiStopAnimation

        public void uiStopAnimation(int animation)
                     throws PinpadException,
                            java.io.IOException
        Stops animation playback started with uiStartAnimation.

        ANIM_INSERT_CARD Insert card animation (MPED400)
        ANIM_REMOVE_CARD Remove card animation (MPED400)
        ANIM_BUSY Busy animation (MPED400,PPAD1)
        ANIM_DROP Water drop animation (MPED400,PPAD1)
        ANIM_INSERT_SMARTCARD Insert smart card animation (PPAD1)
        ANIM_INSERT_MAGNETIC_CARD Insert magnetic card animation (PPAD1)
        Throws:

      • sysLEDControl

        public void sysLEDControl(int led,
                 byte[] pattern)
                   throws PinpadException,
                          java.io.IOException
        Controls the blink pattern of Pinpad's LEDs.

        The pattern represents 1 second, so every bit is 1/16th of a second.

        Parameters:
        led - the led index: 0 - red, 1 - green.
        pattern - the blinking pattern, for every bit 0 means LED is off, 1 - it is on. The value 0xFFFF means led constantly on.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • sysEraseFlashPage

        public void sysEraseFlashPage(int address)
                       throws PinpadException,
                              java.io.IOException
        Erases flash page.

        Page needs to be erased before written to.

        Pages are 128KB each and this function requires to supply the starting address of the page.

        Parameters:
        address - the address of the page to erase (0x00000000~0x003DFFFE).
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • sysWriteFlashPage

                       throws PinpadException,
                              java.io.IOException

        Page needs to be erased before written to.

        data - the data to write to the address. The data length should be aligned to 2 bytes.
        Throws:

        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • emvGetLastStatus

        public int emvGetLastStatus()
        Returns the EMV status from the last executed command.

        The EMV status must be check to determinate whether the EMV command is execute successful.

        Some of the available status codes are defined into EMVStatusCodes interface.

        Returns:
        the EMV status code.

      • emvInit

        public void emvInit()
             throws PinpadException,
                    java.io.IOException
        Through this command the kernel initializes itself and checks that everything is ready to work properly.

        This command should be called only once at the Pinpad power up, additionally it should be the first command call to be made with the exception of the get version data ( emvGetVersion()).

        The main ICC reader should be open by the application, in this way the kernel is independent of the additional usage that the application could do of the reader.

        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvDeinitialise

        public void emvDeinitialise()
                     throws PinpadException,
                            java.io.IOException
        The command allows the application to release all the resources assigned in the initialization process.

        This command should be called only once at the end of the kernel usage, although normally it wont be called if the application is waiting for an ICC insertion endlessly.

        The main ICC reader wont be closed, in this way the kernel is independent of the additional usage that the application could do of the reader.

        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvGetVersion

        public EMVKernelInfo emvGetVersion()
                            throws PinpadException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        The command allows the application to gather details about the EMV kernel software version and release date.

        The data provided by this command can be used by the application to validate the expected version of the kernel; this command can be called prior to kernel initialization.

        Returns:
        the EMV kernel information or null if an error occurs.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvATRValidation

        public void emvATRValidation(boolean warmReset,
                    byte[] atr)
                      throws PinpadException,
                             java.io.IOException
        The command is in charge of validating the ATR sequence got from the card to ensure that is fully EMV complaint and that obeys the rules stated in the specification.
        Parameters:
        warmReset - the type of power up applied if cold or warm power up.
        atr - the ATR sequence received form the card: TS+T0+TB1+TC1+TS+T0+TB1+TC1+TD1+TD2+TA3+TB3+TCK.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvLoadAppList

        public void emvLoadAppList(int method,
                  boolean includeBlocked,
                  EMVApplication[] applications)
                    throws PinpadException,
                           java.io.IOException
        The command initiates the application selection process, loading the application list supported by the terminal. The maximum number of application that can be loaded into the kernel is up to 75. This number is only constrained by the max packet size that can be exchanged on the port (2Kb).

        Initially the command will inspect the incoming data to make sure that if data are provided and that all the data related to terminal applications is valid. If no data has been provided (the list is empty) the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_NO_DATA_FOUND will be returned, in the event of a format failure of the applications data the result got will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_DATA_FORMAT_ERROR. If during the internal procedure of the commands a system error occurs the command will return with the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR, on the other hand if the error occurs dealing with the card or with the data got and the transaction must be aborted according to EMV specification, the result will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_ABORT_TRANSACTION. If the process can be completed correctly and the list is properly parsed and managed the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS will be returned.

        Parameters:
        method - the selection preferred method:
        EMVApplication.SELECTION_METHOD_PSESelection by PSE
        EMVApplication.SELECTION_METHOD_AIDLISTSelection by AID list
        includeBlocked - true if blocked AIDs should be included.
        applications - the array of EMV applications.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvGetCommonAppList

        public EMVCommonApplications emvGetCommonAppList()
                                          throws PinpadException,
                                                 java.io.IOException
        The command gets back the list of common applications supported by the terminal and the card, actually this commands will end or resume the selection procedure.

        Initially the command will check the provided data, if its empty string, the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_NO_DATA_FOUND will be returned, if during the procedure any internal error occurs the status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR. On the other hand, if the process and be completed correctly the possible status returned will be: EMVStatusCodes.EMV_LIST_AVAILABLE, EMVStatusCodes.EMV_APPLICATION_AVAILABLE, EMVStatusCodes.EMV_NO_COMMON_APPLICATION according to the number of common applications found.

        The application may know beforehand the number of common applications by retrieving the value of the data item EMVTags.TAG_COMMON_APP_NUMBER.

        In the event of an application error that doesnt force to abort the transaction, this command will be called again as many times as necessary while the list wont be empty. Internally the Kernel will remove the wrong application so that the selection could be resumed.

        Returns:
        the EMV common applications or null if an error occurs.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvInitialAppProcessing

        public void emvInitialAppProcessing(byte[] aid)
                             throws PinpadException,
                                    java.io.IOException
        Once an application has been selected, the next phase is to start the transaction with it by issuing the GET PROCESSING command and analyzing the information got.

        First the input data are checked, if empty the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_NO_DATA_FOUND is returned, if the length of the AID is incorrect (greater than AID max length or less than TAG minimal length) the status got will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_DATA_FORMAT_ERROR. If any internal error occurs during the processing the status returned will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR. Depending on the application type or status the codes EMVStatusCodes.EMV_EASY_ENTRY_APP, EMVStatusCodes.EMV_INVALID_APPLICATION or EMVStatusCodes.EMV_BLOCKED_APPLICATION could be returned. If the transaction must be aborted due to a processing error with the card or with the data got from it the status returned will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_ABORT_TRANSACTION. EMVStatusCodes.EMV_APPLICATION_NOT_FOUND will be the status got if the AID provided cannot be found in the card. If everything is correct and the application can be initiated properly the status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS.

        At this point of the transaction it could be possible to resume the application selection by calling the ppEmvGetCommonAppList command again, this will depend on the status got, normally for EMVStatusCodes.EMV_EASY_ENTRY_APP, EMVStatusCodes.EMV_INVALID_APPLICATION or EMVStatusCodes.EMV_BLOCKED_APPLICATION the selection should be resumed.

        Parameters:
        aid - the selected application AIDs.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvReadAppData

        public void emvReadAppData(int[] tags)
                    throws PinpadException,
                           java.io.IOException
        The command reads and validates the data informed in the AFL and that will be used along the transaction.

        If during the AFL data reading and validating an error occurs that commits the transaction to be terminated, the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_ABORT_TRANSACTION will be returned. If the error allows the application selection to be resumed, the status returned will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_ERROR_IN_APPLICATION. If during the procedure any internal error occurs, EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR will be returned. On the other hand, if everything is correct and the data can be extracted and validated, the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS will be the value returned.

        At this point of the transaction it could be possible to resume the application selection by calling theemvGetCommonAppList() command again, this will depend on the status got, normally for EMVStatusCodes.EMV_ERROR_IN_APPLICATION the selection should be resumed.

        Parameters:
        tags - the array with EMV tags.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvAuthentication

        public void emvAuthentication(boolean checkAmount)
                       throws PinpadException,
                              java.io.IOException
        Through this command the card data is authenticated depending on the capabilities of the card and the kernel. The method could be static or dynamic, in this case is completed here, or combined that will be carried out later at the application cryptogram generation stage.

        If the authentication can be performed (successfully or not) the command will return EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS. If an internal error occurs the status got will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR. EMVStatusCodes.EMV_ABORT_TRANSACTION will be returned if the transaction must be immediately terminated due to a severe error in the processing. If the check amount flag was enabled and the amount is one of the data items requested by the dynamic data authentication the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_AMOUNT_NEEDED will be returned. If the authentication cannot be completed due to a missing CA public key, the status returned will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_INVALID_KEY.

        EMVStatusCodes.EMV_INVALID_KEY status code will let the application to detect and invalid configuration concerning the CA RSA public keys.

        If the selected authentication method is the CDA, the verification of the CA public key presence and the recovery of the issuer public key is done here prior to the actual CDA verification to be done at the AC generation.

        The reason for setting the checkAmount parameter to true is to allow the application to know if the amount is required as part of the dynamic data used for the authentication. This can be useful if the application plans to be sure that the actual amount will be used in the process rather than a default value set to zero.

        Parameters:
        checkAmount - determine whether the amount is checked for the dynamic authentication.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvProcessRestrictions

        public void emvProcessRestrictions()
                            throws PinpadException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        The command performs the restrictions processing related to application version, application usage control and effective and expire dates.

        If the process can be completed correctly the returned status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS, if any internal error occurs the status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR instead.

        To complete this process the kernel needs from the application the following data items to have been provided prior to this command:
        EMVTags.TAG_APP_VERSION_NUMBER
        EMVTags.TAG_TERMINAL_TYPE
        EMVTags.TAG_ADD_TERM_CAPABILITIES
        EMVTags.TAG_TERMINAL_COUNTRY_CODE
        EMVTags.TAG_TRANSACTION_DATE
        EMVTags.TAG_TRANSACTION_TYPE.

        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvTerminalRisk

        public void emvTerminalRisk(boolean forceProcessing)
                     throws PinpadException,
                            java.io.IOException
        The application risk control is done by this command, including floor limit checking, random selection (only if offline is enabled) and velocity checking.

        If the process can be completed correctly the returned status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS, if any internal error occurs the status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR instead.

        To complete this process the kernel needs from the application the following data items to have been provided previously:
        EMVTags.TAG_RISK_AMOUNT (if offline enabled)
        EMVTags.TAG_AMOUNT_AUTHORISED_BINARY (if online only)
        EMVTags.TAG_FLOOR_LIMIT_CURRENCY (optional)
        EMVTags.TAG_TERMINAL_FLOOR_LIMIT
        EMVTags.TAG_THRESHOLD_VALUE (if offline)
        EMVTags.TAG_TARGET_PERCENTAGE (if offline)
        EMVTags.TAG_MAX_TARGET_PERCENTAGE (if offline)
        EMVTags.TAG_TRANSACTION_CURR_CODE (optional)

        Parameters:
        forceProcessing - determine whether the process should be carried out despite of the AIP configuration.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvGetAuthenticationMethod

        public void emvGetAuthenticationMethod()
                                throws PinpadException,
                                       java.io.IOException
        The command starts or resumes the card holder authentication procedure, the current verification method is communicated to the application.

        The lists of methods and conditions is parsed and processed to identify what are the valid ones according to the kernel capabilities the possible methods available are: EMVStatusCodes.EMV_OFFLINE_PIN_PLAIN, EMVStatusCodes.EMV_ONLINE_PIN, EMVStatusCodes.EMV_OFFLINE_PIN_CIPHERED.
        If during the process an internal error occurs the status is returned, if the transaction has to be terminated the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_ABORT_TRANSACTION will be returned. If there are not more valid methods to be applied the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_AUTH_COMPLETED is set.

        If a combination of methods is required by the card, pin verification plus signature, the kernel directly checks if the latter is possible according to the capabilities, if so the former is informed otherwise the next entry in the list will be processed.

        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvSetAuthenticationResult

        public void emvSetAuthenticationResult(int authResult)
                                throws PinpadException,
                                       java.io.IOException
        Using this command the kernel gets the result of the previously informed verification method.

        Firstly the value of the result informed must be checked, if its value is not a valid one the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_DATA_FORMAT_ERROR will be returned. If the authentication process was not started and no method is currently active the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_NO_CURRENT_METHOD will be got by the application, if the result for the current method was already provided the status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_RESULT_ALREADY_LOADED. EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR will be get by the application if any internal error occurs during the processing. When everything is OK and the result can be stored correctly the status sent back is EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS.

        The actual verification method result according to EMV specification can be recovered by the application at later stage by accessing the data item EMVTags.TAG_CH_VERIF_METHOD_RESULT.

        Parameters:
        authResult - the result of the verification method previously informed:
        EMV_AUTH_RESULT_SUCCESSThe method result was successful.
        EMV_AUTH_RESULT_FAILUREThe method failed.
        EMV_AUTH_FAIL_SEC_DEVICE_FAILThe secure device failed.
        EMV_AUTH_FAIL_PIN_ENTRY_NOT_DONEThe PIN entry was bypassed.
        EMV_AUTH_FAIL_USER_CANCELLATIONThe PIN entry was canceled.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvVerifyPinOffline

        public void emvVerifyPinOffline()
                         throws PinpadException,
                                java.io.IOException
        The command allows the application to apply the offline PIN verification (plain text or encrypted) method.

        Depending on the current PIN entry type (plain text or encrypted) is verified against the card, if the PIN is no valid and is rejected the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_INVALID_PIN will be returned if more than one attempt is still available otherwise the status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_INVALID_PIN_LAST_ATTEMPT. If a severe error occurs so that the transaction should be terminated immediately, the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_ABORT_TRANSACTION will be set. If any kind of internal error occurs during the processing, the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR will be returned. If the verification cannot be completed due to a missing CA public key, the status returned will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_INVALID_KEY. Finally if the PIN is entered and verified correctly the status got will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS.

        The EMVStatusCodes.EMV_INVALID_KEY status code will let the application to detect and invalid configuration concerning the CA RSA public keys.

        The PIN entry process will have to be accomplished by the application calling to the proper commands provided for that aim.

        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvGenerateCertificate

        public void emvGenerateCertificate(int type,
                          int risk)
                            throws PinpadException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        Using this command the application will be able to generate an application cryptogram, the first or the second one, as required by the transaction.

        If any of the incoming parameters value is incorrect the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_DATA_FORMAT_ERROR will be returned. The status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR will be get by the application if any internal error occurs during the processing. If during the cryptogram generation an error occurs that requires the transaction termination, the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_ABORT_TRANSACTION will be informed. If other kind of error occurs during the generation the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_ERROR_AC_PROCESS will be got. If the combined authentication is enabled, EMVStatusCodes.EMV_CDA_FAILED will be returned to indicate that it failed. Finally if the certificate can be obtained with no error the status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS.

        If the CDA is the card data authentication mode the CDA will be always requested on the first cryptogram generation if the cryptogram type to be requested is a TC. It will be always disabled for AAC and for an ARQC depends on the CDA mode active.

        If the CDA is the card data authentication mode the CDA will be disabled on the second cryptogram generation if the cryptogram type to be requested is an AAC, otherwise if the cryptogram type is a TC it will depend on the CDA mode active.

        Parameters:
        type - - specifies AC type AAC:
        EMV_CERTIFICATE_AAC AAC
        EMV_CERTIFICATE_TC TC
        EMV_CERTIFICATE_ARQC ARQC
        risk - the card risk:
        EMV_RISK_CDOL_1CDOL_1
        EMV_RISK_CDOL_2CDOL_2
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvMakeTransactionDecision

        public void emvMakeTransactionDecision()
                                throws PinpadException,
                                       java.io.IOException
        The command checks the action codes (provided by the application and read from the card), the TVR and will determine how the transaction is resolved.

        EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR will be got by the application if any internal error occurs during the processing. First the denial action codes are checked, if any of the bits in the TVR match the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_TRANSACTION_DENIED will be returned, otherwise if the terminal is both offline & online, the online action codes will be checked in the same way and if any of the bits match with the TVR data the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_TRANSACTION_ONLINE will be set, if theres no match at all the status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_TRANSACTION_APPROVED instead. If the terminal is offline only the default action code is checked, if any of the bits in the TVR match the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_TRANSACTION_DENIED will be returned, otherwise the status got will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_TRANSACTION_APPROVED. If the terminal is online only the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_TRANSACTION_ONLINE will be returned.

        According to the latest EMV recommendations concerning the CDA processing (Specification update bulletin No. 44) if the CDA is the card data authentication mechanism to be performed, the previous key recovery process will be accomplished prior to the transaction decision so that CDA errors could be detected in advance and reflected on the TVR.

        The online/offline capability of the terminal is determined by the value of the tag EMVTags.TAG_TERMINAL_TYPE.

        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvMakeDefaultDecision

        public void emvMakeDefaultDecision()
                            throws PinpadException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        The command checks the default action code (provided by the application and read from the card), the TVR and will determine how the transaction is resolved by default.

        EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR will be returned if any internal error occurs during the processing. If any of the bits in the TVR match with the default action codes the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_TRANSACTION_DENIED will be returned, otherwise the status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_TRANSACTION_APPROVED instead.

        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvAuthenticateIssuer

        public void emvAuthenticateIssuer()
                           throws PinpadException,
                                  java.io.IOException
        The command is used to validate the cryptogram got from the issuer.

        If the issuer cryptogram was not set previously, the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_NO_DATA_FOUND will be returned. If during the processing any internal error occurs, the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR will be set. If everything is OK and the cryptogram is verified, the result will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS.

        The data item that the application has to provide to the kernel so that this command could be executed is: EMVTags.TAG_ISSUER_AUTH_DAT

        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvScriptProcessing

        public void emvScriptProcessing(int script)
                         throws PinpadException,
                                java.io.IOException
        The script processing retrieved in the online authorization is handled by this command.

        First the presence of the script in the data repository is checked, if its not present the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_NO_SCRIPT_LOADED is returned. If during the processing any internal error occurs the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR will be set. Once the script has been conveniently processed and issued to the card the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS will be set.

        The script data should be provided to the kernel through the data item EMVTags.TAG_ISSUER_SCRIPTS, and after the processing is over the results can be recovered by accessing the data item EMVTags.TAG_ISSUER_SCRIPTS_RESULT. The maximum length of the scripts supported is 256 bytes.

        Parameters:
        script - the script type to be processed:
        0x71 SCRIPT_71
        0x72 SCRIPT_72
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvUpdateTVR

        public void emvUpdateTVR(int byteIndex,
                int bitIndex,
                boolean set)
                  throws PinpadException,
                         java.io.IOException
        The command allows modifying the TVR directly, setting or clear the desired bits.

        Initially the incoming parameters are validated to ensure that are pointing to a valid location within the TVR structure. If thats not the case, the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_DATA_FORMAT_ERROR will be returned. If during the processing any internal error occurs, the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR will be set. EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS will be returned if everything is correct and the TVR could be updated.

        The aim of this command is to let the application to achieve any additional procedure that could need as a particular requirement. Consult section List of TVR and TSI bits below for the complete list of the bits.

        Parameters:
        byteIndex - the byte index to update. Accepted values are in the range 1~5.
        bitIndex - the bit index to update. Accepted values are in the range (1~8).
        set - specify whether to set or clear the bit.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvUpdateTSI

        public void emvUpdateTSI(int byteIndex,
                int bitIndex,
                boolean set)
                  throws PinpadException,
                         java.io.IOException
        The command allows modifying the TSI directly, setting or clear the desired bits.

        Initially the incoming parameters are validated to ensure that are pointing to a valid location within the TSI structure, if thats not the case the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_DATA_FORMAT_ERROR will be returned. If during the processing any internal error occurs the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR will be set. EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS will be returned if everything is correct and the TVR could be updated.

        The aim of this command is to let the application to achieve any additional procedure that could need as a particular requirement. Consult section List of TVR and TSI bits for a list of the bits.

        Parameters:
        byteIndex - the byte index to update. Accepted values are in the range 1~5.
        bitIndex - the bit index to update. Accepted values are in the range (1~8).
        set - specify whether to set or clear the bit.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvCheckTVR

        public void emvCheckTVR(int byteIndex,
               int bitIndex)
                 throws PinpadException,
                        java.io.IOException
        The command is intended to verify an individual bit within the TVR.

        Initially the incoming parameters are validated to ensure that are pointing to a valid location within the TVR structure, if thats not the case the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_DATA_FORMAT_ERROR will be returned. If during the processing any internal error occurs the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR will be set. EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS will be returned if the given bit is set otherwise it will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_FAILURE.

        The aim of this command is to let the application to achieve any additional procedure that could need as a particular requirement. Consult section List of TVR and TSI bits for a list of the bits.

        Parameters:
        byteIndex - the byte index to check. Accepted values are in the range 1~5.
        bitIndex - the bit index to check. Accepted values are in the range (1~8).
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvRemovePublicKey

        public void emvRemovePublicKey(int rid,
                      int caIndex)
                        throws PinpadException,
                               java.io.IOException
        The command is intended to delete a given CA public key.

        If the input is empty the status returned will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_NO_DATA_FOUND, if the key cannot be found the EMVStatusCodes.EMV_INVALID_KEY status will be got. If during the processing any internal error occurs the returned status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR. Finally if the key can be deleted the status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS.

        Parameters:
        rid - the RID data.
        caIndex - the certification authority public key index.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvSetDataAsBinary

        public void emvSetDataAsBinary(int tag,
                      byte[] data)
                        throws PinpadException,
                               java.io.IOException
        The command sets a data item with data in binary format (raw data).

        Initially the input data is validated, if the buffer is empty the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_NO_DATA_FOUND will be returned, in case of not locating the tag EMVStatusCodes.EMV_NO_SCRIPT_LOADED will be set, if the length of the incoming data is not in the range accepted by the data item the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_INVALID_LENGTH will be returned. The data item attributes are checked to determine whether the item can be written or not, if its not the case the status returned will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_INVALID_TAG. If during the processing any internal error occurs the returned status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR. Once the data has been saved properly the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS will be set.

        Using this method theres no applicable conversion, so the data provided should be in the format that corresponds to the data item to be set. So, in fact, its like setting a given data item with raw data. Consult section List of EMV tags for a list of the data items.

        Parameters:
        tag - the tag id of the data item.
        data - the tag data.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvSetDataAsString

        public void emvSetDataAsString(int tag,
                      byte[] data)
                        throws PinpadException,
                               java.io.IOException

        data - the tag data.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvGetDataAsBinary

        public byte[] emvGetDataAsBinary(int tag)
                          throws PinpadException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        The command gets a data item in binary format (raw data).

        If the length of the data item is greater than the length of the buffer requested the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_INVALID_LENGTH will be set, in the case of not finding the requested item the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_NO_SCRIPT_LOADED will be returned. After checking the item attributes, if the item cannot be read the returned status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_INVALID_TAG. If during the processing any internal error occurs the returned status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR. Finally if everything is OK and the data can be extracted the status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS.

        Using this method theres no applicable conversion, so the data retrieved is in the format that corresponds to the data item. Consult section List of EMV tags for a list of the data items.

        Parameters:
        tag - the tag id of the data item.
        Returns:
        the tag data.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvGetDataAsString

        public java.lang.String emvGetDataAsString(int tag)
                                    throws PinpadException,
                                           java.io.IOException
        The command gets a data item in string format.

        If the length of the data item is greater than the length of the buffer requested the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_INVALID_LENGTH will be set, in the case of not finding the requested item the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_NO_SCRIPT_LOADED will be returned. After checking the item attributes, if the item cannot be read the returned status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_INVALID_TAG. If during the processing any internal error occurs the returned status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR. Finally if everything is OK and the data can be extracted the status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS.

        Using this method theres no applicable conversion, so the data retrieved is in the format that corresponds to the data item. Consult section List of EMV tags for a list of the data items.

      • emvGetDataDetails

        public EMVTagDetails emvGetDataDetails(int tag)
                                throws PinpadException,
                                       java.io.IOException
        The command allows the application direct access to the data of a given item.

        In the case of not finding the requested item the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_NO_SCRIPT_LOADED will be returned. If during the processing any internal error occurs, the returned status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR. Finally, if everything is OK and the attributes can be extracted, the status will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS.

        The aim of this command is to let the application a direct access to the already assigned buffers of the data items. This could be useful to save and to optimize memory usage. It can be also used to determine the presence of an item or to know its current length.

        Parameters:
        tag - the tag id of the data item.
        Returns:
        the tag details.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvSetBypassMode

        public void emvSetBypassMode(int mode)
                      throws PinpadException,
                             java.io.IOException
        With this command is possible to setup the behavior of the KERNEL regarding the PIN based method bypass, so that only the current method will be bypassed or any other found later in the CVM list will be considered so as well.

        If any kind of internal error occurs during the processing or the kernel was not initialized before the status EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SYSTEM_ERROR will be returned. On the other hand if the value can be set correctly the status got will be EMVStatusCodes.EMV_SUCCESS.

        If this command is not used along the transaction the default value applied by the kernel will be EMV_BYPASS_CURRENT_METHOD_MODE. If the expected behavior is other than the default one the call to this command will have to be done prior to the card holder authentication procedure and after application selection.

        Parameters:
        mode - the bypass mode, one of:
        EMV_BYPASS_CURRENT_METHOD_MODEBypass current method
        EMV_BYPASS_ALL_METHODS_MODEBypass all methods
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        See Also:
        emvGetLastStatus()

      • emvSetTags

      • emvGetTags3DESCBC

        public byte[] emvGetTags3DESCBC(int keyId,
                       int id,
                       byte[] tagList)
                         throws PinpadException,
                                java.io.IOException
        Read multiple of tags encrypted with 3DES CBC.
        Parameters:
        keyId - the key index. A value of 0xFF use last generated DUKPT key.
        id - the unique identifier.
        Returns:
        the BerTLV data. The data contains 1 byte tracks mask and the rest is encrypted TLV data.
        The encrypted data contains:
        Field Size Description
        random 4 bytes The random generated number.
        session 4 bytes The session id number.
        length 2 bytes (MSB first) The data length.
        data (length) bytes The BerTLV data
        checksum 2 bytes(MSB first) The crccitt16 over random, length and data fields.
        padding 0~7 bytes The zero bytes padding
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • emv2LoadConfiguration

        public void emv2LoadConfiguration(int type,
                         byte[] data)
                           throws PinpadException,
                                  java.io.IOException
        Load EMV configuration.
        Parameters:
        type - configuration type, one of EMV2_CONFIG_* constant values.
        data - configuration data. 
         - Template 0xE0 - Terminal configuration
 - Template 0xE1 - Application configuration (one for each application)
 - Template 0xE4 - Information
     - Tag 0xC1 - Configuration version - 4 bytes   (big-endian)
 - Template 0xE5 - TAG Lists
      - Tag 0xC1 - Tags that will be returned in 'ONLINE' stage
      - Tag 0xC2 - Tags that will be returned in 'COMPLETE' stage

      • emv2StartTransaction

        public void emv2StartTransaction(int interfaces,
                        int flags,
                        byte[] data,
                        int timeout)
                          throws PinpadException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        Starts EMV transaction. The function waits for payment card to be available, then processes it and notifies of completion. You can cancel the transaction at any time.
        Parameters:
        interfaces - transaction interface like contactless/contact or magnetic. One of the EMV2_INTERFACE_* constants, only works on universal EMV kernel.
        flags - controls the EMV transaction, use 0 for now.
        data - optional TLV structure with additional parameters to be sent to the kernel
        timeout - transaction timeout in seconds, only works on universal EMV kernel.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

        public void emv2SetOnlineResult(byte[] tags)
                         throws PinpadException,
                                java.io.IOException
        Responds to the EMV kernel after an online request was sent to the card and the communication with the financial institution is complete.
        Parameters:
        tags - the input tag data. 
         - Tag 0xC2 - Online success     - 1 byte
                                 - True(1) or False(0)
 - Template 0xE6  - Host response tags.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • emv2CancelTransaction

        public void emv2CancelTransaction()
                           throws PinpadException,
                                  java.io.IOException
        Cancels an active EMV operation and clears all data. Using this function is not required if the EMV transaction completed.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • emv2Initialize

        public void emv2Initialize()
                    throws PinpadException,
                           java.io.IOException
        This command initializes the EMV kernel, call it before calling any other EMV function.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • emv2Deinitialise

        public void emv2Deinitialise()
                      throws PinpadException,
                             java.io.IOException
        This command deinitialise the EMV kernel and frees the allocated resources, call it after you are done with the EMV transaction.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • emv2GetTrackData

        public byte[] emv2GetTrackData(int format,
                      int keyID)
                        throws PinpadException,
                               java.io.IOException
        After transaction is finished, you can get the card data in magnetic-stripe format by using one of the available Encrypted Head formats.
        Parameters:
        format - one of the TAGS_FORMAT_* constants.
        keyID - key ID, one of EMV2_KEY_* constants.
        Returns:
        encrypted block as formatted and encrypted by Emulated EMSR module.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • emv2GetTagsEncrypted

        public byte[] emv2GetTagsEncrypted(byte[] tags,
                          int format,
                          int keyType,
                          int keyIndex,
                          int packetID)
                            throws PinpadException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        After transaction is finished, you can get the tags, encrypted and in a specified format.
        Parameters:
        tags - a list of tags to get. The format is like TLV list without length and value, i.e. every tag takes as many bytes as needed.
        format - one of the TAGS_FORMAT_* constants
        keyType - one of the KEY_TYPE_* constants
        keyIndex - key index.
        packetID - unique packet identifier.
        Returns:
        encrypted block formated and encrypted as specified by the format tag.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - PinpadException if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

                          int packetID)
                            throws PinpadException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        After transaction is finished, you can get the tags, encrypted and in a specified format.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:
        PinpadException - PinpadException if an error is returned from Pinpad.

      • emv2GetTagsPlain

        public byte[] emv2GetTagsPlain(byte[] tags)
                        throws PinpadException,
                               java.io.IOException
        After transaction is finished, you can get the tags in plain. Only non-sensitive tags can be retrieved in plain, no pan/discretionary data will be returned
        Parameters:
        tags - the list of tags to be returned.
        Returns:
        plain TLV data block.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

                 int x,
                 int y,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 boolean dither)
                   throws PinpadException,
                          java.io.IOException
        Print image
        Parameters:

        x - the horizontal position of image.
        y - the vertical position of image.
        width - image width.
        height - image height.
        dither - dither image.

        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • prnGetParam

        public int prnGetParam(int param)
                throws PinpadException,
                       java.io.IOException
        Get printer parameter.
        Parameters:
        param - parameter index. It can be value of
        • (1) - Dots per line
        • (2) - Paper present
        • (3) - Printing
        • (4) - Lines in buffer
        • (5) - Temperature
        Returns:
        the parameter value.
        Throws:
        PinpadException - if an error is returned from Pinpad.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
